result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Brandon K. Rave was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brandon K. Rave was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 3/17/16.  Credit for 256 days served.
Concurrent with: Count 4.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant to comply with all monitoring methods and devices agent deems appropriate.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

supervisions.notes: Per Statute 343.301(g) your operating privileges for operation of Class D vehicles will require that vehicles owned and/or driven by you be equipped with an ignition interlock device.  Must install a mandatory Ignition Interlock Device when defendant obtains an occupational license or regular license.  There is a $50 ignition interlock surcharge imposed.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution hearing to be scheduled within 30 days.  State must provide restitution figures to the defense at least 5 days before the hearing, or restitution will be deemed zero.

JOC amended as Stipulation and Order For Restitution signed and filed 11/29/2016. Judgment of conviction amended to reflect Restitution amount.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant to comply with all monitoring methods and devices agent deems appropriate.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attorney Sebion recommended: treatment court. Defendant's mother spoke to the court.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  14CF138:  Count 4.  7 years total.  3 years in., 4 years ES.  Count 1: 2 in 2 ES.  Concurrent.  $600.00, plus costs OWI.  Alc assmt & DSP.  30 mo.   IID  & dl rev.  PSI recommendation.  

15CF86: OWi:  4: 2 in,  2 ES.  $600.00 plus costs.  Alc assmt & DSP. 30 mo.  IID  & dl Rev.  Count 4:  4 years, 2 in 2 ES.  Concurrent.  & Concurrent to 14CF138.

ES conditions:  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  Restitution:  schedule restitution hearing within 30 days.  State must provide restitution figures at least 5 days before the hearing, or restitution will be deemed zero.      Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. Eligible for CIP and SAR.  DNA sample and surcharge.  Credit for 256 count 4 of 14CF138.

Covers case No. 15CF86 and 14CF138. Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court you shall not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Comply with any other bonds currently in place.  Must live with mother.  Submit to random testing on a regular basis.  Must have a sobrietor/bracelet in place before release.  Not to associate with  other persons in the car with defendant.:  T. W., N.W. and R.W.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Victim rights notification complied with.  None present.  State opposes bond modification.  Attorney Sebion spoke.  Said he will reside with his mother.  Court concerned with public safety, flight risk.  Cash bond remains appropriate.  Reduce cash bond to $8,000.00.  Must live with mother.  Mother in court.  She spoke to court.  She is willing to have him live with her.  Submit to random testing on a regular basis.  Must have a sobrietor/bracelet on.  Attorney Sebion to check with probation agent.  Not to associate with  other persons in the car:  T. W., N.W. and R.W.  Plus, other conditions previously ordered.
for Modification of Bail.
Sentencing hearing at 12-02-2015 09:00 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.   Victim notification complied with.  Son of victim present in the courtroom.  Plead guilty to Count 1, OWI 4th.  Plead guilty to Count 4, 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety.  Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Priors confirmed by court.  Felony warnings given.    Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charges.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Court found the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 4.  Count 2 dismissed by operation of law, and the other counts were dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  PSI ordered due by  11/20/15.  SEH to be set the first week of December.  Bond continued.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in person. Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Attorney Sebion requests lower cash or signature bond.  Attorney Fox argues against.  Concerned with public safety.  Defendant made statement.  Bond continued as previously ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-28-2015 10:30 am

Pre-trial conference on January 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant appeared late with counsel Carly Sebion.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Judge accepted waiver of preliminary hearing after reviewing right to prelim with defendant.  Bound over for trial.  Information filed and defense waived the reading.  Not guilty pleas entered to all counts including traffic citations.  Pre-trial and status dates set.
and certificate of appearance served on Deputy Matt Koran to appear at preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or the Black River Falls Memorial Hospital or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Duncan R.    Defendant's mother, Sherri Larsen, is to assure defendant will appear in court for all appearances, medical, and legal appointments.  Must remain at mother's residence at all times except for medical and legal appointments.  Must go directly to those appointments and return to her home directly after appointments.  SCRAM and GPS required, if not available the Jackson County Jail must advise the Court by August 1, 2014 so the bond can be reviewed.  AMENDED 9-02-14:  May live at own residence at 104 Maplewood Ct., Apt 11, Black River Falls, WI 54615.  AMENDED 11-7-14:  No contact with Duncan R. is lifted.  Must remain on home detention at 104 Maplewood Ct., Apt 11, Black River Falls, WI except for medical and legal appointments, employment purposes, and so defendant can comply with any rules of probation.  Other conditions remain as ordered.
Defendant Brandon K. Rave in court with attorney Carly June Sebion.  Gerald R. Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond amended.

This bond covers 13CM142, 13CM214, 13CT39, 14CM74, 14CM149, and 14CF138:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or the Black River Falls Memorial Hospital or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Duncan R.    Defendant's mother, Sherri Larsen, is to assure defendant will appear in court for all appearances, medical, and legal appointments.  Must remain at mother's residence at all times except for medical and legal appointments.  Must go directly to those appointments and return to her home directly after appointments.  SCRAM and GPS required, if not available the Jackson County Jail must advise the Court by August 1, 2014 so the bond can be reviewed.  AMENDED 9-02-14:  May live at own residence at 104 Maplewood Ct., Apt 11, Black River Falls, WI 54615.
